N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 5 ยง 143.1 - Purpose, scope and applicability

State Regulations
(a) The requirements of this Part apply to all documents soliciting bids or
proposals for State contracts which are issued on or after the effective date
of this Part. (b) In the event that
a State contract is entered into on an emergency basis or where an amendment or
change order has been added to a State contract providing for a total
expenditure in excess of $ 25,000, the contracting agency may require the
contractor to submit an EEO policy statement and to comply with the post award
requirements of this Part during the life of the contract. (c) Pursuant to Executive Law, section
312(3), the requirements of this Part shall not be binding upon contractors or
subcontractors in the performance of work or the provision of services or any
other activity that are unrelated, separate or distinct from the State contract
as expressed by its terms. (d) Based on the restrictions set forth in the applicability provisions of

Executive Law, section 312(6), the requirements of sections 143.4 and
143.6
of this Part shall not apply
to any employment outside this State or application for employment outside this

State or solicitations or advertisements therefor. Notes
